Description:
OverviewThis position description is subject to change at any time as needed to meet the requirements of the program or company.Act as senior technical advisor in support of the U.S. Navy’s Maritime Operations Centers (MOC). Support shore based numbered Fleet Commanders (C3F, C5F, C6F) other Combatant Commands within the AOR. Conducts on-site troubleshooting and maintenance assistance for problems that may cross multiple Navy systems and provides training on those systems. Lead / coordinate troubleshooting with other shore and afloat Fleet Systems Engineers. Candidate will be responsible for daily operations of Full Motion Video (FMV) and Distributed Common Ground System-Navy (DCGS-N) to include systems administration; network engineering; end-user support; requirements analysis, planning, systems integration, and engineering; and serves as a senior technical advisor to the N2/3/6 staff and MOC watch team. TS/SCI Clearance required.ResponsibilitiesMajor Job Activities: NAVCENT MOC Job Activities:Supports Naval Central Command (NAVCENT) in the Middle Eastern AOR at Naval Support Activity Bahrain by performing installation and configuration of Full Motion Video (FMV) and Distributed Common Ground System-Navy (DCGS-N) in the C5F MOC and Navy afloat units deployed or to be deployed in the theater.
Assigned network technical duties which will include installation, configuration and upgrade of system hardware and software. Will interface with customers aboard ships and Maritime Operations Center network / systems operations personnel.
Perform training on systems after configuration, as required.
Assist in development of TTPs.
Support systems located in Bahrain, to include routine systems administration and IA functions (patching, scanning, STIG, etc).
Up to 20% travel may be required, to various ports within the Indian Ocean and Middle Eastern AOR. May be assigned to support FMV or DCGS-N operations at other AOR locations including Iraq.Material & Equipment Directly Used: Navy classified and unclassified C4ISR computer systems and ONE-NET.Working Environment: Candidate will work primarily in computer facilities at Naval commands in an office or computer equipment room environment. Work outside of normal work week hours will be required, to participate in meetings, troubleshooting efforts, and installations or upgrades. Physical Activities: Personnel may be required to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time. Individual must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. unassisted.
The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection of installed computer and network equipment.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications:BS in Information Technology (or equivalent technical degree) or 5+ years technical experience in related discipline required.
IAT Level 2 Certification (Security+, CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC or SSCP) required.
8+ years’ experience with DoD enterprise or Navy networks.
C4I Systems experience: GCCS-J, DCGS-N, CENTRIXS, AIS, C2PC, ENMS, RADMERC, GALE, JTT, CHAT, STJ/MTJ, CAS, JADOCS, VOIP / VOSIP, BICES, FMV, VTC, CRYPTO devices and others.
Active DoD TS-SCI Security Clearance.Experience / Skills: Network operations and maintenance with experience in server virtualization and systems administration (Unix and/or Windows) required.
Network operations and maintenance experience with FMV and DCGS-N required for NAVCENT MOC.
Experience troubleshooting network and operating system issues across multiple platforms.
Knowledge of fleet communications architectures required.
Knowledge of military C2 architectures required.
Must be able to communicate well both orally and in writing.
Must be able to communicate well with senior Navy / DOD officials and technical personnel.
Candidate must be able to provide training as needed.Supervisory / Budget Responsibilities:  N/AWe are committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace that values and supports the contributions of each individual. This commitment along with our common Vision and Values of Integrity, Respect, and Responsibility, allows us to leverage differences, encourage innovation and expand our success in the global marketplace. Vectrus is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or status as an individual with a disability.
